name: Jam Jelly Doughnut French Toast
description: French toast dressed up as a strawberry jam jelly doughnut! At 230 calories per serving it's so much healthier than Krispy Creme. And remember, it's french toast, so you can have dessert for breakfast!
recipeIngredient: 6 slices white sandwich bread (, stale, 1.5cm/0.6" thick (see notes))

recipeInstructions.text: Optional: Cut the bread into rounds, as large as you can. See notes for tip.
recipeInstructions.name: Optional: Cut the bread into rounds, as large as you can. See notes for tip.

recipeInstructions.text: Spread 1 tbsp of strawberry jam into the middle of 3 of the rounds, leaving an edge of about 1cm / 1/4" so when you put the sandwich together, the jam does not ooze out of the side. (See photo below) Put sandwich together.
recipeInstructions.name: Spread 1 tbsp of strawberry jam into the middle of 3 of the rounds, leaving an edge of about 1cm / 1/4" so when you put the sandwich together, the jam does not ooze out of the side. (See photo below) Put sandwich together.

recipeInstructions.text: Place egg and milk in a small bowl and beat lightly.
recipeInstructions.name: Place egg and milk in a small bowl and beat lightly.

recipeInstructions.text: Spread sugar on a small plate.
recipeInstructions.name: Spread sugar on a small plate.

recipeInstructions.text: Heat butter in large non stick pan over medium high heat.
recipeInstructions.name: Heat butter in large non stick pan over medium high heat.

recipeInstructions.text: Quickly dip each side of a sandwich into the egg mixture, then roll the edge in the egg mixture as well. Then place in the pan. Repeat with remaining sandwiches.
recipeInstructions.name: Quickly dip each side of a sandwich into the egg mixture, then roll the edge in the egg mixture as well. Then place in the pan. Repeat with remaining sandwiches.

recipeInstructions.text: Cook each side for around 2 minutes, until a deep golden brown.
recipeInstructions.name: Cook each side for around 2 minutes, until a deep golden brown.

recipeInstructions.text: Remove from the pan and immediately place on the plate with the sugar to coat each side and the edges. The faster you get it from the pan into the sugar, the better the sugar will stick.
recipeInstructions.name: Remove from the pan and immediately place on the plate with the sugar to coat each side and the edges. The faster you get it from the pan into the sugar, the better the sugar will stick.

recipeInstructions.text: Serve warm or at room temperature.
recipeInstructions.name: Serve warm or at room temperature.

review.reviewBody: My family loved this for breakfast this morning. I used the cutter from my pie maker to make the rounds which was the perfect size and put the jam in then cut 2 slices together so it sealed the edges into a little jam pocket - made it easier to manoeuvre.
My toddler loved this and also my husband! Used homemade cherry jam and my husband used all of the milk on his coffee so used coconut milk instead. They loved it!

Well, these are the kids favourite 'brekky' at the moment ðŸ˜œ One has strawberry jam, the other raspberry..I ALWAYS put vanilla in my egg mixture.. Tastes more doughnutty or something.. And we must not forget the whipped cream on the side! I'm a naughty mummy ðŸ˜±ðŸ˜œ..!
Simple ingredients, satisfying taste! I made these 3 times already! Square "jelly donuts"  taste as good as round ones :)!

Ohh Nagi,  these are so delicious.  I was on my own for lunch and fancied a sweet treat,
these were perfect,  thanks for another great recipe.

You'll probably shake your head in sadness but I'm one who loves eggy French Toast.  ;}

I made your recipe using Tank Bread (white bread shaped like a giant soup can) and kept the crust on because my local bakery bakes loaves with soft crusts.  Mmmm, Mmmm good.  Thank you so much for sharing, Nagi!
